lead_paragraph: A major rebel group and President Andrés Pastrana's administration said today that they would resume peace talks this weekend in Cuba, three months after the government broke off negotiations, citing a lack of will on the part of the guerrillas. The news was a small positive development for Mr. Pastrana, whose peace efforts with the National Liberation Army and a larger rebel group have foundered amid growing violence. The rebel group, the National Liberation Army, said it would resume talks without conditions.
abstract: National Liberation Army, major rebel group in Colombia, and Pres Andres Pastrana's administration say they would resume peace talks, three months after government broke off negotiations, citing lack of will on part of guerrillas (S)
